tweet_text: SEEN IN KIGALI: To prevent the risk of #Coronavirus outbreak, passengers at the Kigali Bus Park have to wash their hands before getting onto buses. #Rwanda has recorded NO case of the epidemic but the country has stepped up vigilance. https://t.co/tb7cfUNj7K
MISTRAL_7B_INSTRUCT_reasoning: The tweet mentions a factual claim that passengers at the Kigali Bus Park have to wash their hands before getting onto buses. This claim is verifiable and can be checked by visiting the bus park or contacting the relevant authorities. The tweet also mentions that Rwanda has recorded no cases of the coronavirus epidemic, which is also a factual claim that can be checked by referring to reliable sources such as the World Health Organization or the Rwandan Ministry of Health. The tweet does not contain any false information and is not harmful to the society, certain people, companies or products. Therefore, the tweet is check-worthy and deserves a high score.
MIXTRAL_INSTRUCT_reasoning: The tweet does not contain a verifiable factual claim. The tweet is stating that passengers in Kigali are washing their hands before getting on buses to prevent the risk of Coronavirus outbreak. This is a good practice and it is not check-worthy.
